But, starting from the last 2 days of on this drug to this day, I have been feeling nausea, weak, lower back pain and stomack disconfort.       I was a very healthy & active person, and I was not on any prescription drug before I started taking Prevpac. I regret having taken this drug solely based on the Urea Breath test.  How reliable are the breath tests?

column1: Other
column2: whytakeit, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I told my doctor about my dry mouth during an annual routine physical.  He gave me a blood test for H. Pylori.  The result was inconclusive.  Then he gave me a breath test which was +.  He perscibed me the Prevpac.  But I do not have any of the symptms of stomach ulcer caused by H. Pylori.  Since most people with H. Pylori have no symptms and I don't want to have the high risk of getting cancer.  So, I decided to take it.  I am on the sixth day of Prevpac.  I have experienced bitter taste since taking the Prevpac.  I don't know if it works for me or not since I didn't have any of the symptoms of this ulcer before I started Prevpac. My dry mouth seems worse after taking Prevpac.

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: Danielle , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed as having the H Pylori infection after having a month of dull and sharp pains in my left side and sour stomach for weeks when my stomach was empty. My doctor gave me Prevpac to which I was very weary of taking because of the reviews I read. I took my meds at the EXACT time every day. I took them with a pretty high dose of probiotics which helped SO MUCH with any possible side effects. I took my AM with breakfast and my PM right before bed. The only effects I had were the first two days were really tiring and I had a headache. I took these first two days on a weekend and took some pain meds. After that the two weeks werent bad. I had small bouts of diaphrea on and off but nothing to cry about. The only constant thing was the metallic taste in my mouth that kind of messed with my tast but mint gum helped a lot with that as well as taking it before bed so that it really didnt bother me. Needless to say... my pain went away slowly and nearly disappeared after stoping the meds. I took my 2 weeks post antibiotic test and came back cleared of H Pylori so my experience wasnt all that bad. I hope this helps.

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: Molly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After reading all the reviews on this site i was very skeptical about this treatment. But my labs came back positive for the bacteria and i def. wanted to get rid of it. I have been on the treatment for a week now, and the first couple of days I felt very nauseous after taking the morning portion. I also had a horrible taste in my mouth that would almost make me gag and it would also wake me up in the middle of the night because it was very disgusting, but its gotten a lot better now. I have been eating sugar free oatmeal with 2% lactose free milk in the mornings and having two yogurts from the only brand i found that actually mentioned the active cultures on the ingredients to prevent yeast infection that other people mentioned. So far, all this has worked, and i have been feeling no pain and ive continued my normal activities and normal food. I have also had normal bowel movements. I would say this treatment is agressive but if you make sure that you eat things to prevent an irritation in your stomach you should be perfectly fine.

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Other
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this after a positive H. Pylori blood test. An ulcer has not be specifically confirmed, but symptoms seem to indicate that I have one.My doctor ordered the three medications separately. I honestly don't know if they come combined. 20 mg of Lansoprazole, 1 g of Amoxicillin  and 500 mg of Clarithromycin. The instructions from the doctor's office for taking them were to take the Lansoprazole a half hour before a meal (breakfast and dinner) and then take the two antibiotics after the meal.The only side effects I had from the meds were some minor diarrhea 24 hours after the first dose that lasted a few hours. I was feeling all better 36 hours. I did have ravenous hunger about two or three hours after the meds for the first two or three days but that went away. I did have a bitter/metalic taste in my mouth that would start about three hours after taking the meds and last for a few hours. It wasn't anything that affected my appetite. While I was eating I couldn't taste it. One other thing I did notice is I tended to feel more full then usual after eating. Other then those side effects I didn't have any others. No nausea, vomiting, upset stomach, etc.Since I just finished the protocol a few days ago I can't say that it has completely rid me of the infection. However, my heartburn has subsided quite a bit. I did read that it can take two to eight weeks for ulcers to completely heal after treatment.The biggest pain about the whole experience was remembering to take the proper pill at the proper time.I highly recommend doing the treatment. Chances are you'll have the same side effects I did (they are the most common) and they really aren't that bad considering the alternatives with having an untreated H. Pylori infection (bleeding ulcers and cancer).

column1: Other
column2: vanillabean, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After having read some reviews on the prevpac I was apprehensive about taking it.  I have problems with anxiety and I don't like to take medication.  I'm on Day 7 and haven't had any problems.  My symptoms are gone, my appetite is back and I'm able to eat.  The only side effects I've felt are that funny taste in the mouth and a dry mouth.  I remedy that by sucking on hard candy or chewing gum.  I also drink plenty of water.  I take probiotics with my lunch and have had no problems with diarrhea or stomach cramping.  Please keep in mind that the majority of people who take this drug have no problems and feel much better after taking it.  People who have side effects are more likely to write reviews on websites.  Don't be afraid to take this medication.  People who are symptomatic and positive for H Pylori need to take this treatment.  I love homeopathic/alternative medicine but there are no proven studies that any of that works to get rid of the H. Pylori once you've been infected.  For me I will probably look to alternative/natural therapies (diet, herbs, honey, etc) once I complete the treatment.  For me the motivation to stick with this treatment was the realization that I could become much sicker and develop ulcers or worse!  Best wishes to everyone who is fighting this infection!

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: mittens, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started the 3rd day.  I read a lot of these before starting it.  I take in the AM on an empty stomach.  Don't eat for 2 hrs then eat very light.  I do get loose bowels, not diarrhea.  Lasts in the AM maybe 15 minutes.  Never in the evening.  I do not eat 3hrs before the evening dose, and I do not eat after.  No problems.  Sleep well.  Do have slight headache, one tylenol cures.  I get some nausea in AM only.  Use cold compress on back on neck, stops that. I take the doses with a full 16 oz's of water and I drink water all day. One 8 OZ glass an hour. I am post kidney cancer (one kidney), no gallbladder. I am followed closely by my Kidney Dr.  Overall, the meds do not really effect me as some have said.  I suggest an empty stomach for each dose.  Works for me.

column9: 2nd diagnosis for H Pylori, primary physician prescribed Prevpac then sent me to see my Gastroenterologist who said blood tests are not an accurate way to diagnose H Pylori, either a specific breath test or a biopsy done via an upper GE can accurately diagnose, he said to finish the prevpac and then I'm having a CT scan , also he said after you finish 1st dose of Prevpac you have to wait several weeks to do the breath test or biopsy otherwise you will get a false negative if you do it too soon. column2: fourbluesxipink, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter took this drug for 30 days because of a h-pylori. She was 14 years old. I will never forget those 30 days, nor will she. She had such severe stomach pain while taking it that she was rolling around on the floor in horrible pain many times. That was two years ago.Now my husband is taking it (14 days) with horrible stomach pain as well. He can't leave the house because his pain is so severe. He is incredibly uncomfortable, and I hear him moaning many times. It was the same way for my daughter. This has been a very difficult treatment in our household. However, it did work for my daughter, and cleared up her h-pylori in her stomach and she felt it was worth it.

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: PAINFUL BUT I HAVE THE SOLUTION, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The first 2 days, I received every side effect possible, except for the bad taste in the mouth. Vomiting, excruciating stomach pains, dizziness, weakness, diarrhea and nausea. Then I realized, it only happened in the mornings, right when i ate. At night (which is about 2-3 hours after I ate) I received no side effects. What worked for me is this: Give at least a 2 hour gap from when you eat and take the pills. Meaning, if you ate at 8am, don't take the pills until 10am. Then don't eat for another 2 hours. You also need a full 12 hour gap between the morning & evening treatment. 10am/10pm works best for me. Drink lots of water, and be on a high fiber diet during this 14 day period. You will get frequent headaches & trouble sleeping/bad dreams. I do promise though, if you stick with the 2 hour/12 hour regiment I explained, it will work much better.I still, however, hate this medication. It's the worse I've ever took in my entire life. I never get side effects and this is the first time. Those first 2 days, when I took it as directed, my symptons were worse than LABOR.

column1: Ulcer of Duodenum caused by Bacteria Helicobacter Pylori
column2: Jrking296, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After finding out I had h-pylori in Oklahoma, strong stomach pain as far as strong back pain. I went to the E.R. and they did a blood workup. They prescribed this to me. I took all of it and went back home to Texas and made a checkup with my family physician. He took more blood and still came back as I had h-pylori. He prescribed another 14 day Prevpac. Going on my third dosage now I still have it. The second time around I was starting to get the side effects as deep depression, runny stools, and adominal pain. I told my doctor the side effects I was experiencing but he still prescribed the third dosage. I've taken 10 doses of the third and the side effects are coming back. I don't know if the medication is working at all since I've taken it three times and the blood work still shows I have it. I'm scared to think that if it doesn't treat it that this could turn into stomach cancer. After the experience that I've been going through, I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.After living with the pain for a little over seven months and taking three dose packs it isn't clearing up what my doctor said "wasn't a big deal."
